com.googlecode.javacpp

Class PointerPointer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.javacpp.Pointer
      • com.googlecode.javacpp.PointerPointer

  • public class PointerPointer
extends Pointer
    The peer class to native pointers and arrays of void*. All operations take into account the position and limit, when appropriate.

    To support higher levels of indirection, we can create out of the Pointer objects returned by get(int) additional PointerPointer objects.

    Author:
    Samuel Audet

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class com.googlecode.javacpp.Pointer

      PointerPointer put(Pointer... array)
      Writes the Pointer values into the native void* array.
      PointerPointer put(Pointer p)
      Calls in effect memcpy(this.address + this.position, p.address + p.position, size), where size = sizeof(p) * (p.limit - p.position).
      PointerPointer put(short[]... array)
      Creates one by one a new Pointer for each short[], and writes them into the native void* array.

        public PointerPointer position(int position)
        Description copied from class: Pointer
        Sets the position and returns this. That makes the array.position(i) statement sort of equivalent to the array[i] statement in C++.
        Overrides:

        Parameters:

      • put

        public PointerPointer put(Pointer p)
        Description copied from class: Pointer
        Calls in effect memcpy(this.address + this.position, p.address + p.position, size), where size = sizeof(p) * (p.limit - p.position). If limit == 0, it uses position + 1 instead. The way the methods were designed allows constructs such as this.position(0).put(p.position(13).limit(42)).
        Overrides:
        put in class Pointer
        Parameters:
        p - the Pointer from which to copy memory
        Returns:
        put(0, p)

      • put

        public PointerPointer put(int i,
                 Pointer p)
        Copies the Pointer value to the i-th element of a native array.
        Parameters:
        i - the index into the array
        p - the Pointer value to copy
        Returns:
        this
